items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Sport
items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

items.title: UHP
items.description: Used on sports and super cars in warm weather, sporty handling, and quick acceleration

content.body:
### Shop 255/70R16 Tire Size
255/70R16 tires were very popular for early to late-2000 model year trucks, and have begun reappearing on trucks from 2019 on. If you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 1500, Ford Ranger, GMC Sierra 1500, Mazda B4000, or Mitsubishi Montero Sport, you might have 255/70R16 tires, and a new version of any of these trucks likely rolled out of the factory with a set of [Bridgestone Dueler H/T 685](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/dueler-h-t-685), General AmeriTrac TR, or Bridgestone Dueler H/T 689 tires attached.

Popular vehicles
1999-2004 Chevrolet Silverado 1500
2005-2011, 2019-2021 Ford Ranger
1999-2004 GMC Sierra 1500
2005-2008 Mazda B4000
2000-2004 Mitsubishi Montero Sport

Most drivers only use one set of tires, making all-season tires a popular choice thanks to their ability to perform in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions. Check out the Yokohama Geolandar H/T G056, General Grabber HTS60, and [GT Radial Adventuro HT](https://simpletire.com/brands/gt-radial-tires/adventuro-ht) if you need a set of 255/70R16 tires that perform s year-round.

Trucks like the Chevrolet Silverado 1500 and Ford Ranger might spend some time off-road, so they need a tire that’s built to perform on any terrain. All-terrain tires are a great option for drivers who want off-road traction without sacrificing on-road performance, so check out the [Pirelli Scorpion All Terrain Plus](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-all-terrain-plus), BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, and Nexen Roadian AT Pro RA8 if you want a set of 255/70R16 tires that performs on any terrain.

All-season tires are great for year-round traction and all-terrain tires are engineered to perform on any terrain, but both might struggle with heavy ice, slush, and snow. Fortunately, winter tires are built to perform in these conditions and tires like the Bridgestone Blizzak DM-V2, [Hankook Winter i Pike RW11](https://simpletire.com/brands/hankook-tires/winter-i-pike-rw11), and Toyo Observe G3-Ice are great options if you’re looking for extra traction and grip.

Whether you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 1500, Ford Ranger, Mitsubishi Montero Sport, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 255/70R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
